reviews.review: I got the bundle with portal/portal 2 and portal was a game that I really enjoyed playing through, a nice game with a mix of action and strategy. I finished portal 1 and moved on to portal 2, which blew me away. Portal 2 has a lot more puzzles than portal 1 and it does not feel like really anything is repeated. The game throws in new mechanics gradually, which is a nice change to make it feel less repetitive. I really recommend this game if you like puzzles of any kind and you will definitely get your money's worth with the amount of puzzles, the amazing story, the intricate details in the map, and the community levels afterwards.
i have played for 10 hours and it is a very fun game. online mode and story mode is really hard but gets pretty fun...

iconic game with great mechanics and comedy
I absolutely love everything about the game, the humor is great, the music is great, and most importantly the story is amazing.

This may be the funniest game I've ever played, but I haven't played too many games I would call a comedy. Compelling gameplay, I find myself just goofing off with the physics sometimes. If you don't like FPS but like puzzle games, or if you like games with fun physics, I would absolutely recommend giving this (or the first one) a try.
it's really fun and challenges your brain
Simplesmente o melhor game de puzzle que eu ja joguei

It's amazing, there's a lot of different things to explore in the game with secrets! The achievements can be a little bizzare, not that it matters, but this game is amazing. The graphics, mechanics, and even seeing yourself in a portal! I also have this on an Xbox 360, and even on that its amazing! I'd recommend this too any players who like traveling through some portal!

By far my favourite puzzle game of all time. Love the story line and voiceovers. Overall amazing game for an extremely cheap price (especially when in sales). Loved every moment playing through this game and all the head scratching that goes on when your trying to figure out some of the harder levels. Not much to critique, all I can say is buy it if you like a challenge.

[h1]One of the Best Games I've Ever Played[/h1]

I'll admit, I was late to experience this game and it's predecessor (I got both in the bundle), but I'm incredibly GLaD I finally did.  The story is engaging, the humor is brilliant, the voice acting it top-notch, and the gameplay is tons of fun.  It always felt so rewarding to solve a particularly difficult test chamber.

Specifically about the story, it immediately captured my heart.  Like I said, I was late to the party for this universe, but after finishing the singleplayer campaign, I just wanted more.  Now while I don't think we need actual Portal 3 now that [spoiler]Chell has been freed[/spoiler], but there is still a ton of story potential in Aperture Science, as the Co-op campaign demonstrates.

It you haven't played these games yet, stop waiting around, buy the bundle, and enter Aperture to learn why the cake is a lie and what's up with lemons.
Honestly if you hate Portal, you're not human.
More Portal and this time you can be with a friend.
